definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) A cheerful attitude; happiness ; a good, happy, or positive mood . [from 14th c.]
( now uncountable ) That which promotes good spirits or cheerfulness, especially food and entertainment prepared for a festive occasion.
examples: a table loaded with good cheer

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A cry expressing joy , approval or support , such as " hurrah ". [from 18th c.]
examples: Three cheers for the birthday boy!
A cheer rose from the crowd.

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A chant made in support of a team at a sports event .
( obsolete ) One's facial expression or countenance . [13th–19th c.]

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A cheerful attitude; happiness ; a good, happy, or positive mood . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now uncountable ) That which promotes good spirits or cheerfulness, especially food and entertainment prepared for a festive occasion.
( countable ) A cry expressing joy , approval or support , such as " hurrah ". [from 18th c.]
( countable ) A chant made in support of a team at a sports event .
( obsolete ) One's facial expression or countenance . [13th–19th c.]

definitions.definition: Cheerleading , especially when practiced as a competitive sport.
examples: Alex participated in cheer all four years of college.
I'm going to wear my new cheer shoes at cheer today.

main_definition: ( chiefly Canada , US ) Cheerleading , especially when practiced as a competitive sport.
